title: 3 Simple Ways to Download YouTube Videos to the iPad

steps.title: Open the YouTube app.
steps.content: Open the YouTube app. You can also use YouTube in a mobile web browser. Before you can use the Cobalt tool, you'll first need to copy the YouTube video link. Keep in mind that some videos cannot be downloaded due to age restrictions, privacy settings, or other restrictions or bugs.

steps.title: Navigate to a video.
steps.content: Navigate to a video. You can browse your feed and playlists, or use the search bar at the top to find a specific video. Once you find a video, tap it.

steps.title: Tap Share.
steps.content: Tap Share . This is the button underneath the video. It will have a right-pointing arrow.

steps.title: Tap Copy link.
steps.content: Tap Copy link . The video's URL will be copied to your iPad's clipboard.

steps.title: Go to Cobalt in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to Cobalt in a web browser. You can use any mobile web browser on your iPad. [1] X Research source This website allows you to directly download YouTube videos onto your iPad for free.

steps.title: Tap the link field and tap Paste.
steps.content: Tap the link field and tap Paste . You can tap the paste icon on the on-screen keyboard (paper and clipboard icon), or tap the blank link field to open the paste menu. You can also tap Cobalt's paste button at the bottom right of the field, and then tap Paste . The link will be pasted in the field, and a pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Download.
steps.content: Tap Download . This is underneath choose how to save . A new page will open with the download prompt.

steps.title: Tap Download again.
steps.content: Tap Download again. The video will begin downloading to your device. If you're using Safari, you can check its progress in the top-right corner, next to the address bar. This may take some time depending on the size of your video.

steps.title: Open the Files app.
steps.content: Open the Files app. Now that you've completed the download, you can find it in the iOS Files app. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Downloads folder.
steps.content: Tap the Downloads folder. Depending on your settings, you may find this folder in the On My iPad location, iCloud Drive location, or another synced location. To browse your folders, tap the sidebar icon to expand it. Then, tap a location under the Locations header.

steps.title: Tap your video to view it.
steps.content: Tap your video to view it. The video should be in your Downloads folder in full. Tap the play button to view it. If needed, you can change the video's orientation by tapping the icon of the cube with the curved arrow.

steps.title: Download Documents by Readdle from the App Store.
steps.content: Download Documents by Readdle from the App Store. This free app comes with its own web browser and file management tools that make it easy to download videos to your iPad. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Open Documents and move through the welcome screens.
steps.content: Open Documents and move through the welcome screens. After installing Documents, tap Open in the App Store, or tap the Documents icon to launch the app. The first time you open it, you'll have to move through a few welcome screens that ultimately bring you to a screen called My Files. You can stop when you get there.

steps.title: Tap the compass icon.
steps.content: Tap the compass icon. It's at the bottom of the screen. This opens the built-in web browser.

steps.title: Go to the VideoSolo website in the built-in web browser.
steps.content: Go to the VideoSolo website in the built-in web browser. Copy and paste the link, or enter it manually into the field. You can also go to videosolo.com and select Online-Downloader in the top-right corner of the page. Always be careful when using third-party web tools. After using any free tools, professional technologist Stan Kats advises to look out for adware, which may look like ads suddenly appearing all over your device. If you see adware or malware, you'll need to detect and remove it .

steps.title: Open the YouTube app on your iPad.
steps.content: Open the YouTube app on your iPad. You'll need to enter the URL of the YouTube video you want to download into the VideoSolo downloader. Return to the Home screen and launch the YouTube app to get started.

steps.title: Select a video.
steps.content: Select a video. Tap the video that you want to download onto your iPad. This starts playing the video in the YouTube app.

steps.title: Copy the link to the video.
steps.content: Copy the link to the video. To do so, tap Share below the video, and then tap Copy Link to save the link to your clipboard.

steps.title: Return to the Documents app and paste the copied URL into the field.
steps.content: Return to the Documents app and paste the copied URL into the field. Documents will still be open to the VideoSolo downloader site. Tap the Paste the link here box, and then tap Paste when it appears.

steps.title: Tap Download to view downloading options.
steps.content: Tap Download to view downloading options. You'll see the sizes available for download.

steps.title: Download the video in the desired size.
steps.content: Download the video in the desired size. The higher the number in the "Quality" column, the larger the file, and the better the quality. Tap Download next to the size you want, and then tap Done to start the download. Some of the better-quality options may require a paid upgrade. Usually a lower-quality file will still look great on your iPad's large screen.

steps.title: Tap the rectangle icon to return to "My Files".
steps.content: Tap the rectangle icon to return to "My Files". It's at the bottom-left corner.

steps.title: Tap the Downloads folder.
steps.content: Tap the Downloads folder. This is where you'll find the video you saved.

steps.title: Move the video to the Photos app.
steps.content: Move the video to the Photos app. This makes it easy for you to find the video so you can watch it later. You can move the video to a different folder if you prefer, but you'll definitely want to move it outside of Documents (unless you want to watch it in the Documents appâ€”which you can do!): Tap the three dots at the bottom of the video and select Move . A list of locations you can move the video to will appear. Tap Photos (or the desired folder). Tap Allow Access to All Photos to continue (this will only appear the first time you try to move a file to Photos from Documents). Tap Move . You can now open the Photos app and tap the video in the Recents folder.

steps.title: Open the YouTube app.
steps.content: Open the YouTube app. It's the icon of a white triangle on a red background. You will need to have a paid subscription to YouTube Premium to use this method. If you don't have one, tap the profile photo at the top-right corner of YouTube and select Get YouTube Premium . [4] X Research source

steps.title: Go to the video you want to download.
steps.content: Go to the video you want to download. You can search for the video or select something from your Library.

steps.title: Tap the Download icon.
steps.content: Tap the Download icon. It's a downward-facing arrow icon below the video window. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Select a quality.
steps.content: Select a quality. Tap the checkbox to the right of a quality setting (e.g., 720p ) in the pop-up window. The higher the quality, the more space the video will take up on your iPad. Once you select a quality, the video will begin to download.

steps.title: Watch the video offline.
steps.content: Watch the video offline. When you're offline, just open the YouTube app, tap the Library tab, and then select the video. You can remove the downloaded video at any time by tapping the blue-and-white checkmark icon below the video and selecting Remove .
